comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Prince Henry (with the plumed hat) was the prince consort of Queen Wilhelmina, Queen of the Netherlands from 1890 until 1948, when she abdicated in favor of her daughter. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wilhelmina_of_the_Netherlands He was Duke Heinrich Wladimir Albrecht Ernst of Mecklenburg-Schwerin (April 19, 1876 – July 3, 1934). They were married in 1901. This looks like Versailles and is probably from the same event as hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ggbain.13132, a Bain picture not loaded to Flickr (yet). ftvdb.bfi.org.uk/sift/title/22826?view=synopsis suggests June 1912 might have been the date, because the film has a segment from that date, 'Fallieres and Queen Wilhelmina seen entering a state coach together, '. Fallieres was President of France.

comment.author: 26124874@N04
comment._content: Prince Henry is actually short for Prince Hendrik of Mecklenburg-Schwerin. He was a duke and was not made Prince of the Netherlands until February 6, 1901. See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hendrik_of_Mecklenburg-Schwerin He and Queen Wilhelmina had a daughter, the heir to the throne, Princess Julia, who became Queen in 1948.
